text: Foreword Introduction Sunday Monday  Day 1 Tuesday  Day 2 Wednesday  Day 3 Thursday  Day 4 Friday  Day 5 Monday  Day 6 Tuesday  Day 7 Wednesday  Day 8 Thursday  Day 9 Friday  Day 10 Day 11.
Name: Book 17

text: Whoever said, "Sticks and stones may break your bones but words can never hurt you," was a liar.
Name: Book 17

text: Taken by themselves, the numerous incidents of my grade school career which shaped me into the person I am today seem a tad trifle.
Name: Book 17

text: However, when clumped together, they make up the troubled and lonely childhood that would forge much of my current personality.
Name: Book 17

text: Through the years I've learned to understand and accept the things that happened to me, but I'd be lying if I said there wasn't a bit of residual pain lurking about in the deep recesses of my heart.
Name: Book 17

text: This book is a work of fiction based on events that I've endured during the course of my life.
Name: Book 17

text: I've shared these stories in hopes that those struggling through hardships of their own might feel uplifted knowing that their pain is not without purpose, their efforts are not in vain, and their voices do not go unheard.
Name: Book 17

text: God works all things together for His greater purpose, and only when we learn to look past the pain can we hope to see the positive outcome that our struggles yield.
Name: Book 17

text: Many of the events in this book actually happened to me.
Name: Book 17

text: But I know that these things happen to people of all ages every single day.
Name: Book 17

text: If you are one of those people, I hope this story will help you to understand why God allows bad things to happen in this world.
Name: Book 17

text: And if you're blessed enough to have never faced such battles, then I hope this book will give you a better understanding of those who have.
Name: Book 17

text: You can't climb a ladder without starting at the bottom.
Name: Book 17

text: The phrase may be clich, but it is true.
Name: Book 17

text: In all aspects of life, one can't grow flowers without first burying seeds in the dirt.
Name: Book 17

text: This book is dedicated to my mother and father, the wonderful parents with whom I was blessed.
Name: Book 17

text: Thank you for being my parents, for loving and supporting me, and for never giving up your faith in me.
Name: Book 17

text: And to the Lord Jesus Christ, my eternal pillar of strength, my light in the darkness, who had mercy on my soul when I didn't deserve it, and who refused to give up on me when I gave up on myself: Thank you Lord for giving me the strength, determination, and willpower to carry on fighting for what's right.
Name: Book 17

text: Thank you for the courage to stand against persecution and tell the world of the King of Kings, the Lord of Lords, the Hero of Heroes.
Name: Book 17

text: And thank you for teaching me the valuable lessons that have brought healing to the scars of my past.
Name: Book 17

text: I pray that You'll help each of us to place Your will before our own every single day so that we might finally learn what real happiness is all about.
Name: Book 17

text: "If this keeps up, I'm going to blow my brains out.
Name: Book 17

text: It wasn't until I actually said those words that I realized I'd hit rock bottom.
Name: Book 17

text: I didn't just say them.
Name: Book 17

text: My mind was already working out how I would do it.
Name: Book 17

text: Dad's old handgun was still in my closet.
Name: Book 17

text: Before he died, there were times that I worried he might come home in a drunken rage and turn the thing on me.
Name: Book 17

text: It wouldn't have been too out of character for him, but given our history, I can't say I would've blamed him, either.
Name: Book 17

text: Sorry, I'm getting ahead of myself.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't know how or why you've come across this journal.
Name: Book 17

text: But if my shrink's predictions are any indication, the tales that follow will probably sound like the rambling delusions of a madman.
Name: Book 17

text: And maybe that description will be accurate.
Name: Book 17

text: For now, I can merely speculate.
Name: Book 17

text: Regardless, I'm a bit leery of this new treatment.
Name: Book 17

text: According to my doctor, scientists have cracked the secrets of time travel.
Name: Book 17

text: Go ahead and read that again.
Name: Book 17

text: That's what I thought too.
Name: Book 17

text: It's got to be a scam of some kind, right.
Name: Book 17

text: I mean, I know technology has progressed a lot over the past fifty years.
Name: Book 17

text: Glass-screened televisions were replaced by interactive holograms, and ground-based cars finally gave way to the aeromobile.
Name: Book 17

text: Even the military's standard assortment of assault rifles and body armor have been tossed aside in favor of invisibility cloaks and science-fiction style laser weapons.
Name: Book 17

text: Come on, that's got to be a hoax.
Name: Book 17

text: That's what I believed, anyway, until I called my health insurance company.
Name: Book 17

text: Get thisthey agreed to cover the expenses.
Name: Book 17

text: It's nearly impossible to get any kind of money out of an insurance company.
Name: Book 17

text: I can't imagine they'd agree to cover a procedure that isn't authentic, tested, and reliable.
Name: Book 17

text: I wonder how much it would cost me without health insurance.
Name: Book 17

text: Ugh, just thinking about it makes me angry.
Name: Book 17

text: But that's another topic for another time.
Name: Book 17

text: Anyway, the first of these time-travel sessions is scheduled for Monday morning.
Name: Book 17

text: I suppose some people would jump at the chance to go back and relive their childhood experiences.
Name: Book 17

text: Doc believes that doing this will help me come to terms with the painful memories that have scarred me so deeply as well as give me a better understanding of my role in God's plan.
Name: Book 17

text: I once believed all that stuff the pastors said on television about how God only wanted the best for His children and that we were not put here to suffer but to prosper.
Name: Book 17

text: Faith in Jesus Christ was something I'd clung to when I was younger because He was all I had.
Name: Book 17

text: I used to wake up early on Sunday mornings to listen to Fred Hoskins speak about Jesus, and I'd pray so hard that something would change in Mom and Dad so that they'd one day be completely different people.
Name: Book 17

text: I wanted them to be normal parents.
Name: Book 17

text: I wanted them to stop fighting all the time.
Name: Book 17

text: I wanted my mother to quit drinking.
Name: Book 17

text: I wanted Dad to stop yelling at us and just love us.
Name: Book 17

text: And for years, I prayed and prayed for it to happen.
Name: Book 17

text: Pastor Hoskins used to say that miracles happened every day.
Name: Book 17

text: So I figured that eventually one would have to happen in my house.
Name: Book 17

text: One day I would have the family I'd always wanted.
Name: Book 17

text: It never happened, of course.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't really know why.
Name: Book 17

text: I probably didn't deserve it for one reason or another.
Name: Book 17

text: Whatever the case, as I got older, I lost faith in God's protection.
Name: Book 17

text: It felt like I was holding up a shield that wasn't there.
Name: Book 17

text: And even though I still believe He exists, I've learned to stop expecting Him to help me when I struggle.
Name: Book 17

text: I was destined to be on my own, and I've tried to cope with that.
Name: Book 17

text: Then again, I guess the fact that I'm in therapy means I haven't coped as well as I'd hoped.
Name: Book 17

text: I guess I'll find out Monday.
Name: Book 17

text: Anyway, Doc suggested that I write in this journal after each session to try to sort out my feelings about the things I see and hear.
Name: Book 17

text: It doesn't matter if they make sense when I write them, he says.
Name: Book 17

text: In time, he believes they will.
Name: Book 17

text: I have doubts about that, of course.
Name: Book 17

text: I know what happened in my life.
Name: Book 17

text: I vividly remember the events that left me so jaded and bitter about the world around me and the society that plagues it.
Name: Book 17

text: Everything from my first fight to Mom's death lurks within my memory and torments me each and every waking hour of the day.
Name: Book 17

text: If I could've forgotten such images, if there was a way to abandon all memory of the pain, I'd have done it long ago.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't know what Doc hopes to prove.
Name: Book 17

text: But I guess there's no harm in finding out.
Name: Book 17

text: After all, Dad's gun will still be there when it's all over.
Name: Book 17

text: My name is Herbert.
Name: Book 17

text: Yeah, go ahead and laugh.
Name: Book 17

text: Tomorrow's the big day.
Name: Book 17

text: But I decided that it might be a good idea to write down exactly how I feel about the state of my life as it is today.
Name: Book 17

text: That way, if this treatment does make some kind of difference, I can look back at this entry and see the changes within myself.
Name: Book 17

text: So how did I go from an innocent baby brought into a world of infinite possibilities to the cynical, frustrated, pessimistic, angry, and depressed wretch of a person that I am today.
Name: Book 17

text: Think back to your school days.
Name: Book 17

text: Do you remember the kid in the back of the classroom.
Name: Book 17

text: That quiet one who was different from everyone else.
Name: Book 17

text: Maybe he didn't dress the same as most kids.
Name: Book 17

text: Maybe he had a different haircut or liked different music.
Name: Book 17

text: Perhaps he came from a poor family and his clothes were often dirty.
Name: Book 17

text: You picked on him for being different.
Name: Book 17

text: It was no big deal; everyone else did it.
Name: Book 17

text: You giggled at him and called him names.
Name: Book 17

text: You knocked his books off his desk and pretended it was an accident.
Name: Book 17

text: You shot spit-wads at him.
Name: Book 17

text: You excluded him from games at recess.
Name: Book 17

text: It was funny to you, and that's all that really mattered.
Name: Book 17

text: And I still haven't gotten over it.
Name: Book 17

text: Don't get me wrong.
Name: Book 17

text: I understand that, to an extent, children simply don't know any better.
Name: Book 17

text: They don't understand the deep psychological effects that their teasing can have on another child.
Name: Book 17

text: But by the end of sixth grade, I sure knew.
Name: Book 17

text: And I had heard and seen enough of my fellow students' reprimands and punishments to know.
Name: Book 17

text: I had expected such juvenile abuse to minimize as we were taught the differences between right and wrong.
Name: Book 17

text: And school wasn't my only problem.
Name: Book 17

text: At times, it was the least of my problems.
Name: Book 17

text: As I indicated earlier, my parents weren't exactly model citizens.
Name: Book 17

text: When Mom was sober, her patience with me was thinner than Dad's vocabulary.
Name: Book 17

text: Or resume, for that matter.
Name: Book 17

text: Anyway, she openly admitted that she regretted having me.
Name: Book 17

text: She thought having a child would help her relationship with Dad.
Name: Book 17

text: Something about having responsibilities that were more important than their "petty" problems.
Name: Book 17

text: But Dad never wanted me.
Name: Book 17

text: He was a man who never grew past age eighteen in maturity.
Name: Book 17

text: He drank, he partied, and he didn't come home for weeks at a time.
Name: Book 17

text: He beat Mom frequentlyoften right in front of me.
Name: Book 17

text: He never laid a hand on me, though.
Name: Book 17

text: Sometimes he'd befriend me long enough to let me believe we might be able to form some kind of a relationship.
Name: Book 17

text: We went hunting and fishing a couple of times.
Name: Book 17

text: But then he'd turn on me just as quickly, screaming obscenities before grabbing a couple of beers and racing off in his pickup truck.
Name: Book 17

text: Mom was the one who administered my beatings.
Name: Book 17

text: I learned to accept it, for the most part.
Name: Book 17

text: I'd just clench my jaw, squeeze my eyes shut, and wait for it to end.
Name: Book 17

text: It certainly motivated me to be obedient and well-behaved around her.
Name: Book 17

text: But I never understood any of it.
Name: Book 17

text: I thought families were supposed to love and support each other.
Name: Book 17

text: They were supposed to encourage you.
Name: Book 17

text: To help you learn and grow.
Name: Book 17

text: Grandpa loved me, I know, but I only got to see him a handful of times out of the year, and he died when I was ten years old.
Name: Book 17

text: For the most part, my day-to-day life was devoid of love and affection.
Name: Book 17

text: There was none of it in my household.
Name: Book 17

text: The only conclusion I could come to was that the typical picture of a loving family was nothing more than a fairytale.
Name: Book 17

text: It didn't really exist.
Name: Book 17

text: Then I saw Pastor Hoskins on the holovision one morning when I was twelve.
Name: Book 17

text: I had seen his show on and off growing up, but I'd never really paid much attention to it.
Name: Book 17

text: He was talking about God's commandments regarding families that day.
Name: Book 17

text: Husbands and wives, according to God, were supposed to love each other.
Name: Book 17

text: Children were expected to honor their parentssomething I surely hadn't been doing, given how they treated me.
Name: Book 17

text: I started watching Pastor Hoskins more routinely after that.
Name: Book 17

text: I wanted to know more.
Name: Book 17

text: Over the next few weeks, I learned that God had sent His son Jesus to pay the penalty for our sins because He loved us so much.
Name: Book 17

text: He didn't need to, and humanity certainly didn't deserve it.
Name: Book 17

text: That was the kind of love I wanted.
Name: Book 17

text: The only thing I needed to do to receive this love was accept Jesus as my Lord and Savior.
Name: Book 17

text: Our sins must be paid for, Pastor Hoskins said.
Name: Book 17

text: There would be no justice, otherwise.
Name: Book 17

text: The God of Israel is a just God, and He declares that the wages of sin is death.
Name: Book 17

text: So that's why Jesus died on the cross as a sacrificial lamb.
Name: Book 17

text: Christ suffered through death to pay the price for our sins so that we wouldn't have to.
Name: Book 17

text: All we need to do to be saved from judgment is say a prayer accepting Jesus' sacrifice as payment for our sins and believe in Him as our Lord and Savior.
Name: Book 17

text: So that's what I did.
Name: Book 17

text: I know a lot of people don't believe in God.
Name: Book 17

text: I can understand to an extent.
Name: Book 17

text: Believing requires faith, and faith is in short supply these days.
Name: Book 17

text: But I simply cannot believe that our cycle of birth-life-death is some sort of random or accidental occurrence.
Name: Book 17

text: I've done a lot of research on the subject over the course of my life, seeking evidence both for and against the existence of God and the legitimacy of the Bible, and I've found no conclusive proof either way.
Name: Book 17

text: I guess I should've expected as much given that the Bible clearly illustrates that a relationship with Jesus Christ is based on faith.
Name: Book 17

text: But I would've thought that I'd find some kind of hard evidence against the Bible's claims.
Name: Book 17

text: Granted, I'm no scientist, but the evidence they call "proof" is riddled with words such as "probably" and "suggests" and "assume.
Name: Book 17

text: None of these words can be used when presenting solid evidence as fact.
Name: Book 17

text: I could go much deeper, but that's not what this journal is supposed to be about.
Name: Book 17

text: And the shortcomings of science aren't the only reason I believe.
Name: Book 17

text: The other part of it is hard to explain.
Name: Book 17

text: See, when a person gives their life to Christ, their faith is justified with knowledge.
Name: Book 17

text: I know that doesn't mean anything to someone who doesn't believe, and I don't expect to convince anyone with it.
Name: Book 17

text: But when you honestly and truly give your life to God, He fills you with His spiritthe Holy Spiritwhich in turn gives you the comforting assurance that your faith is not in vain.
Name: Book 17

text: You just.
Name: Book 17

text: know.
Name: Book 17

text: Once I was armed with the knowledge that God loved me, I went back into the world.
Name: Book 17

text: Jesus said the greatest commandment for us to follow is that we must love each other.
Name: Book 17

text: Like many other new Christians, I believed that following His instructions would bring me everything I needed and wanted in my life.
Name: Book 17

text: If I was showing the love of Christ to others, they would in turn be kind and loving to me.
Name: Book 17

text: Clearly, I had not yet come across the part about being persecuted, abused, and ostracized for following Christ.
Name: Book 17

text: Classmates were even more harsh when they found out that I was a Christian.
Name: Book 17

text: It was just another thing about me that made me different.
Name: Book 17

text: I tried befriending people who had previously abused me.
Name: Book 17

text: I tried befriending those I had previously abused.
Name: Book 17

text: I did everything I could to set a good example for others to follow.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm not trying to give you a false impression.
Name: Book 17

text: I was no saint, and I didn't think of myself as one.
Name: Book 17

text: I was simply trying to improve myself, watch my words, and love people in spite of their actions.
Name: Book 17

text: After all, that's what I wanted them to do for me.
Name: Book 17

text: But by the time I graduated middle school, it was clear that no amount of "killing with kindness" was going to get me anywhere.
Name: Book 17

text: Fed up with the juvenile attitudes of my schoolmates and abandoning all hope of any sort of relationship with my parents, I decided I would give everyone exactly what they wanted.
Name: Book 17

text: I would blend in with the shadows.
Name: Book 17

text: I would stay out of everyone's way.
Name: Book 17

text: I would stop trying to make friends.
Name: Book 17

text: I would not speak unless spoken to.
Name: Book 17

text: I'd stop trying to interact with the world.
Name: Book 17

text: Society wanted no part of me, and I wanted no part of society.
Name: Book 17

text: I would be the loner that I was destined to be.
Name: Book 17

text: High school brought four more years of torment.
Name: Book 17

text: Despite my attempts to stay out of everyone's targeting scopes, I was still a magnet for abuse.
Name: Book 17

text: The jocks mocked me with ruthless persistence, never missing an opportunity to deepen the scars.
Name: Book 17

text: Ambushes, stolen property, shredded school work, locker room embarrassment; it felt like it would never end.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm sure we'll address some of these incidents in the days to come, but it would be impossible to relive them all.
Name: Book 17

text: I tried attending a teenage youth group at a local church.
Name: Book 17

text: That was a disaster.
Name: Book 17

text: I really thought a group of people calling themselves Christians would've been more accepting, loving, and above all else, humble.
Name: Book 17

text: What I found was something entirely different.
Name: Book 17

text: These kids were the same type of arrogant and obnoxious teens that filled my school.
Name: Book 17

text: The only difference is that they seemed to think that being Christian made them saints above the rest of the world.
Name: Book 17

text: And that, of course, gave them the right to look down their noses at everyone else.
Name: Book 17

text: My opinion of church members soured quickly.
Name: Book 17

text: Clearly, these people had not read a thing about the humility and love that Jesus had taught.
Name: Book 17

text: In junior year, my first and only girlfriend did more than break my heart.
Name: Book 17

text: She shattered the last remaining sliver of faith I had in the human race.
Name: Book 17

text: For the first time, suicide finally entered my mind.
Name: Book 17

text: After all, I'd done so much for God but He'd done nothing in return.
Name: Book 17

text: Grandpa was long gone; there wasn't a soul on earth who loved me.
Name: Book 17

text: No one would've missed me.
Name: Book 17

text: No one would've noticed.
Name: Book 17

text: But I couldn't do it.
Name: Book 17

text: I was afraid of what would happen if I didn't succeed.
Name: Book 17

text: The last thing I needed was to be unwanted, unloved, and paralyzed or disabled in some other way.
Name: Book 17

text: Besides, I felt like killing myself would've been like saying I didn't think God was doing a good enough job of taking care of me.
Name: Book 17

text: Mom died during my senior year of high school.
Name: Book 17

text: I really don't want to go over the details here, but let's just say that no one should ever have to witness the things I saw that day.
Name: Book 17

text: Besides, if this time-travel thing is for real, I'm sure Doc will make me relive the whole horrific event at some point.
Name: Book 17

text: Five years later, while I was working a job at the local grocery store, I got a call informing me that Dad had died of a massive heart attack.
Name: Book 17

text: I hung up the phone and went back to work.
Name: Book 17

text: I'd grown so cold to the world around me that I didn't even care.
Name: Book 17

text: Not very Christian-like, I know.
Name: Book 17

text: After settling Dad's affairs, I moved into a studio apartment a few blocks away.
Name: Book 17

text: And that's how I've spent the last five years of my life.
Name: Book 17

text: I just don't understand people.
Name: Book 17

text: I've tried; Lord knows how I've tried.
Name: Book 17

text: I've read my Bible and prayed to God for understanding.
Name: Book 17

text: I've gone to work telling myself to look for the good in people, to give them the benefit of the doubt, to love them despite their short-comings, to give of myself to others as Christ gave to us.
Name: Book 17

text: But every time I try to see good in people, they show me their worst sides.
Name: Book 17

text: After years of working in the retail industry, I can safely say that the majority of the people in this country are selfish, conceited, uptight, unloving, and unforgiving parasites.
Name: Book 17

text: The only thing they seem to care about is what they can get, how little they have to give up for it, and how much they are worshiped throughout the whole process.
Name: Book 17

text: Every day I try to love people.
Name: Book 17

text: But every day I grow to hate them more.
Name: Book 17

text: And so, after a particularly bad day at work a few years ago, I really needed to talk to someone.
Name: Book 17

text: I felt like I was on the verge of insanity.
Name: Book 17

text: I got into my aeromobile, unsure of where I was going or what I was trying to find.
Name: Book 17

text: I knew I wanted to die.
Name: Book 17

text: I was sick of trying to push forward with this life.
Name: Book 17

text: I was tired of trying to be a part of society.
Name: Book 17

text: I cried out to God, tears streaming from my eyes.
Name: Book 17

text: Through blurred vision, I caught a glimpse of a sign for a Christian psychiatric care center as I turned a corner.
Name: Book 17

text: Inside, I told them I needed help and I needed it bad.
Name: Book 17

text: I was crying like a baby, begging for someone to fix me.
Name: Book 17

text: That's when Doc came out of his office to investigate the commotion.
Name: Book 17

text: I've been going to him weekly ever since.
Name: Book 17

text: He somehow thinks that I could make major progress in overcoming my issues if I can find a way to understand and make peace with the events of my past.
Name: Book 17

text: And that's where this time-travel treatment comes in.
Name: Book 17

text: It is supposed to give me a new perspective on the events that have left such deep emotional scars.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't know how that could be possible.
Name: Book 17

text: But what I do know is that I can't keep living like this.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't want to hate people anymore.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't want to be terrified to leave my apartment anymore.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't want to hate my job anymore.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't want to run away from relationships anymore.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't want to blame God for my pain anymore.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't want to be scared of the world anymore.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't want to be this person anymore.
Name: Book 17

text: It's time for a change.
Name: Book 17

text: Monday - Day 1.
Name: Book 17

text: This time-travel stuff is real.
Name: Book 17

text: This is no hoax, no scam, no bluff.
Name: Book 17

text: I shouldn't have doubted.
Name: Book 17

text: Doc was one hundred percent serious about this therapy.
Name: Book 17

text: Today, we took a test run to get myself familiar with the Chronopodthat's what Doc calls the time machineand I saw things I never thought possible.
Name: Book 17

text: I arrived at Doc's office a little after eight in the morning.
Name: Book 17

text: He greeted me at the door; his secretary doesn't usually come in until after nine.
Name: Book 17

text: "Good morning, Herbert," he said, opening the glass door to his office.
Name: Book 17

text: "I trust you slept well.
Name: Book 17

text: "I guess," I told him.
Name: Book 17

text: "Can't say I'm looking forward to this.
Name: Book 17

text: "You've nothing to fear.
Name: Book 17

text: I won't let anything happen to you.
Name: Book 17

text: Come; the Chronopod awaits.
Name: Book 17

text: Doc led me down a long hallway past his office and study.
Name: Book 17

text: Most of the lights were still off as his first patients weren't scheduled to arrive for hours.
Name: Book 17

text: The door at the end was locked electronically; only by holding each of his fingers against a scanner could he release the mechanism.
Name: Book 17

text: When the door finally slid open, I couldn't help but feel a bit intimidated.
Name: Book 17

text: The Chronopod stood in the center of the dark room.
Name: Book 17

text: It looked like a giant pill of some kind, a steel capsule no less than twelve feet tall with a single circular window.
Name: Book 17

text: Wires, tubes, and hoses ran from the lower portion of the pod into the floor.
Name: Book 17

text: The rest of the room was barren with the exception of a couple of chairs near the far wall.
Name: Book 17

text: It almost looked like something that Doc had picked up at a garage sale somewhere and tossed into storage to be forgotten.
Name: Book 17

text: But he'd told me last night that the unit would be powered and ready to go by morning, and the blinking green button on its side seemed to indicate just that.
Name: Book 17

text: Middle school was where the person I am today began to take shape.
Name: Book 17

text: While I had trouble with bullies in elementary school, it wasn't anything like the trials that came with middle school.

text: Those three years taught me that growing up also meant dumbing down, degrading others, and displaying an overall lack of maturity.

text: Odd, considering that the whole process of adolescence was supposed to develop maturity.

text: Anyway, today's goal was to explore some of the less noble things I did to my fellow students.

Name: Book 17

text: His chest heaved with every breath, and his whole body was shaking.
Name: Book 17

text: "Hey," I called, trying to keep my eyes away from the bleeding wounds on either side of his head.
Name: Book 17

text: "Can you hear me.
Name: Book 17

text: Herbie, I'm" While I was mid-sentence, the world blinked.
Name: Book 17

text: I suddenly found myself in the backseat of my own aeromobile on a stormy night.
Name: Book 17

text: Herbie was at the controls, apparently oblivious to my presence there.
Name: Book 17

text: Tears streamed from his eyes as he drove through the pouring rain, screaming at God the whole way.
Name: Book 17

text: "What did you put me here for, huh.
Name: Book 17

text: "I'm tired of it.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm tired of trying to do my best for you only to be kicked in the teeth again.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm tired of putting myself out there as a sacrifice for you just to get spit on by people who don't understand it.
Name: Book 17

text: What good are my efforts to love people when no one recognizes any of it.
Name: Book 17

text: All they care about is what they want.
Name: Book 17

text: And I'm tired of scratching and clawing my way through a world that could get along just fine without me.
Name: Book 17

text: It all came rushing back to me.
Name: Book 17

text: I remembered this night; it was my first time to Doc's office.
Name: Book 17

text: I had just been through my worst customer encounter ever, a woman who had done nothing but belittle and humiliate me in front of both my manager and other customers.
Name: Book 17

text: The dispute was over a price mistake, and it was a big one.
Name: Book 17

text: They had shifted the locations of two displays around, and in the process, the merchandising team had missed a couple of old price tags.
Name: Book 17

text: As a result, a case of aspirin that normally sold for thirty bucks was marked at two and some change.
Name: Book 17

text: Not a big deal, in the long run.
Name: Book 17

text: We would just make the price adjustment and call it a day.
Name: Book 17

text: But that wasn't enough for this lady.
Name: Book 17

text: She wanted twenty cases at that price.
Name: Book 17

text: At first, she also demanded that my boss retrain me so that I'd learn how I'm supposed to "bow to the customer" as she put it.
Name: Book 17

text: Then she changed her mind and demanded that I be fired.
Name: Book 17

text: Over and over again, she screamed, "I want him gone.
Name: Book 17

text: I'll never shop here again if he isn't escorted out of this building right this instant.
Name: Book 17

text: He should be working as a circus janitor, trudging through elephant crap.
Name: Book 17

text: I had tried to reason with her at first.
Name: Book 17

text: But when I told her that I had to get my boss to approve the sale of twenty cases at the marked down price, she went ballistic.
Name: Book 17

text: And yes, he did wind up approving the markdown.
Name: Book 17

text: Her attacks had cut deep.
Name: Book 17

text: I managed to keep my composure until I made it back to my aeromobile, but once I was on the road, I lost it.
Name: Book 17

text: "You said you want me to serve people.
Name: Book 17

text: "I'm trying my hardest to do it, but it's not making a difference to anyone.
Name: Book 17

text: The only thing I'm accomplishing is bringing more pain and misery upon myself.
Name: Book 17

text: I looked through the window.
Name: Book 17

text: We were almost to Doc's office.
Name: Book 17

text: At the time, I had no idea where I was going.
Name: Book 17

text: I was just driving randomly and screaming at God over and over again.
Name: Book 17

text: So when I saw the sign for a Christian Psychiatric Center, I decided to go inside and see if anyone could help me.
Name: Book 17

text: I didn't want to go home in that condition.
Name: Book 17

text: But when Herbie rounded the corner this time, my jaw dropped.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 17

text: There was no psychiatric center.
Name: Book 17

text: A pizza parlor stood in its place, complete with a giant illuminated pizza that rotated atop the restaurant.
Name: Book 17

text: It was a well-weathered building, clearly having seen its share of seasons over a good number of years.
Name: Book 17

text: Still, believing that everything I was seeing was a dream anyway, I shrugged it off after a minute or two.
Name: Book 17

text: "You said you wouldn't give me more than I could handle.
Name: Book 17

text: Herbie yelled, looking at the sky through the windshield.
Name: Book 17

text: "But I've had more stress and heartache in my life than I've been able to handle since the day I was born.
Name: Book 17

text: The aeromobile surged forward as he pushed the accelerator to its limit.
Name: Book 17

text: "I tried and tried to hang in there.
Name: Book 17

text: I tried to look for the good in people.
Name: Book 17

text: I tried to spread kindness to those who spit in my face.
Name: Book 17

text: I put myself out there again and again only to be beaten into submission every time.
Name: Book 17

text: By this point, I was getting kind of nervous.
Name: Book 17

text: The vehicle was moving well beyond speed limits for the lower streets.
Name: Book 17

text: The skyways above the town were meant for faster travel, but at ground level, this kind of momentum would be far more difficult to control.
Name: Book 17

text: Herbie weaved in and out of traffic like a lunatic, screaming out his frustrations the whole way.
Name: Book 17

text: As he did, the strangest feeling began to creep over mea feeling of familiarity.
Name: Book 17

text: It was almost as though I remembered doing something similar to this in real life.
Name: Book 17

text: A sort of strange dj vu.
Name: Book 17

text: After blowing through three traffic lights and nearly running another aeromobile into the ground, we finally set down just outside myI mean Herbie'sapartment complex.
Name: Book 17

text: "I'll show you," he growled, tearing the key from the vehicle's ignition.
Name: Book 17

text: He continued as he threw open the door and set foot on the pavement.
Name: Book 17

text: "I'll show you how fed up I am.
Name: Book 17

text: I won't take any more of this wretched world's abuse.
Name: Book 17

text: I reached for my door handle, but the world blinked again.
Name: Book 17

text: In a single flash of light, I found myself standing in my bedroom.
Name: Book 17

text: Herbie sat slumped in the corner by his nightstand, face red and eyes redder.
Name: Book 17

text: The sun was just beginning to come up; lines of morning light shone through the blinds and illuminated the side of his face.
Name: Book 17

text: He was mumbling something, but my attention was immediately drawn to the gun in his hand.
Name: Book 17

text: The one I've kept in my closet ever since he died.
Name: Book 17

text: The one I had considered using on myself the evening I met Doc.
Name: Book 17

text: "You can't stop me," Herbie said softly.
Name: Book 17

text: He was still talking to God.
Name: Book 17

text: "You can't, and you won't.
Name: Book 17

text: You don't care enough to stop me.
Name: Book 17

text: You'll let me blow my own brains across the room because you don't care.
Name: Book 17

text: Remembering the pain and agony I'd felt that night as I drove around in the rain, I knew that this emotional breakdown was not simply because some lady at work had given me a hard time.
Name: Book 17

text: This was a lifetime in the making, a collapse brought on by everything from Timmy Jentson's bullying to my father's death.
Name: Book 17

text: And at the time, I knew nothing about my father's change in behavior and lifestyle after Mom died.
Name: Book 17

text: All I knew was that my heart was twisted in agony, unable to take any more.
Name: Book 17

text: But this, the vision of myself in the corner with my father's gun was something I didn't remember.
Name: Book 17

text: I didn't recall ever falling far enough to actually dig it out of my closet.
Name: Book 17

text: Yet the whole thing seemed so familiar.
Name: Book 17

text: I could almost feel my hands shaking as I gripped the handle, feel the nausea churning in my stomach as I stood up, feel the sweat dripping from my forehead as I pushed the barrel against the side of my head.
Name: Book 17

text: I could feel it all as I watched Herbie do the very same.
Name: Book 17

text: "One shot, and I'll be free," he whispered.
Name: Book 17

text: "One second, and it's over.
Name: Book 17

text: No, less than a second.
Name: Book 17

text: And I'll be freed from this torturous nightmare you call life.
Name: Book 17

text: The next several moments seemed to move in slow motion.

frame.Frame: Cause  change  of  position  on  a  scale

Name: Book 17

text: Herbie lifted glistening eyes to the heavens and whispered, "I've failed.
Name: Book 17

text: My mouth went dry.
Name: Book 17

text: I tried to scream.
Name: Book 17

text: At the same time, I saw a streak of light shoot through the window, a glowing aura of the purest white that wrapped itself around Herbie.
Name: Book 17

text: I heard the gunshot, and in that split second, the light revealed the shape of an angel with beautiful wings that wrapped themselves around him like a cocoon.
Name: Book 17

text: The bullet shot clean through both wings and Herbie's head, shattering the window on its way out.
Name: Book 17

text: Then, just as soon as it had appeared, the angel vanished, and Herbie's body slumped to the floor.
Name: Book 17

text: "Everything happens for a reason.
Name: Book 17

text: I found myself back in the sea of mist, though Herbie was nowhere to be seen.
Name: Book 17

text: I turned around to find Doc standing several paces away.
Name: Book 17

text: He was smiling at me as usual, though there was a hint of what I could only describe as satisfaction in his eyes.
Name: Book 17

text: "I know it's clich, but it's true.
Name: Book 17

text: "What was all that.
Name: Book 17

text: I asked him, still trying to comprehend the vision.
Name: Book 17

text: "What did I just see.
Name: Book 17

text: "Herbert, God has blessed mankind with free will.
Name: Book 17

text: Humanity has the right to do, say, and live as they please.
Name: Book 17

text: It is a God-given right.
Name: Book 17

text: He wants people to follow Him out of love, out of trust, and out of respect.
Name: Book 17

text: He's not interested in mindless drones.
Name: Book 17

text: "You've always struggled to understand why God would allow bad things to happen in this world.
Name: Book 17

text: Why He'd allow you to suffer through the things you have.
Name: Book 17

text: Why He'd allow children to die of starvation across the globe every day.
Name: Book 17

text: If He is so loving, why doesn't He intervene.
Name: Book 17

text: After all, He's God; He can do anything, right.
Name: Book 17

text: I nodded slowly, still unsure of what he was getting at.
Name: Book 17

text: "He doesn't intervene because people have free will.
Name: Book 17

text: Sure, He will perform miracles at times, but for the most part, He lets people live their lives.
Name: Book 17

text: The evil, the pain, the suffering, the struggles, the deathall of it comes from humanity's decision not to follow His commandments.
Name: Book 17

text: No one is without sin.
Name: Book 17

text: Hearing that, I began to frown.
Name: Book 17

text: "So you're saying that I've brought my problems on myself because I'm not perfect.
Name: Book 17

text: "To an extent, but it's far more than that.
Name: Book 17

text: God doesn't expect you to be perfect.
Name: Book 17

text: He knows you cannot be.
Name: Book 17

text: If any man could attain perfection without the help of the Lord, there would've been no purpose in Jesus Christ's sacrifice.
Name: Book 17

text: But just as a father disciplines his child for stealing from the cookie jar, so too will God discipline man for his sins.
Name: Book 17

text: Not because He doesn't love you or doesn't forgive you, but because He wants you to learn from your mistakes and grow into the man He created you to be.
Name: Book 17

text: It made sense to a point, but there were plenty of instances in my life where I was seemingly punished for no reason.
Name: Book 17

text: My fight with Timmy, for example.
Name: Book 17

text: "I don't see how my getting beaten up by bullies taught me to grow or learn from my mistakes.
Name: Book 17

text: The only thing that taught me was to try to avoid people in any way that I could.
Name: Book 17

text: His eyebrows drooped as he let out a long breath and shook his head.
Name: Book 17

text: "Herbert, I really don't want to offend you, but it needs to be said: The world doesn't revolve around you.
Name: Book 17

text: That certainly caught me off guard.
Name: Book 17

text: I never thought that it did.
Name: Book 17

text: "Are you sure about that.
Name: Book 17

text: he asked, raising a finger.
Name: Book 17

text: If there was one thing I knew about Doc, it was that his assessments of any given situation were spot-on accurate.
Name: Book 17

text: And I'll admit that sometimes I was so hurt by what people did to me that I hadn't considered what drove their actions in the first place.
Name: Book 17

text: But I've never considered myself to so self-absorbed that I disregarded the rest of the world entirely.
Name: Book 17

text: Before I could say anything, Doc put his arm around my shoulder.
Name: Book 17

text: "Then let's take a look," he said, pointing to the left with his other hand.
Name: Book 17

text: To my astonishment, the swirling mist began to gather together, spinning and coalescing into two figures.
Name: Book 17

text: Colored waves began to ripple through both as their features solidified right in front of me.
Name: Book 17

text: Each hue rolled across like paint on a canvas, filling the forms with the tones and shadows of their real-world counterparts.
Name: Book 17

text: It all happened too quickly for my brain to really keep up, but before I knew it, I was looking at the ghostly reflections of little Herbie and Timmy Jentson.
Name: Book 17

text: They stood frozen in time like a still from a movie.
Name: Book 17

text: Timmy had a handful of Herbie's shirt in one fist while his other reared back to strike.
Name: Book 17

text: "How in the world did you do that.
Name: Book 17

text: "I want you to tell me what kind of thoughts and emotions well up inside when you look at this image," he said.
Name: Book 17

text: The longer this dragged on, the more I was beginning to feel that it might not be a dream.
Name: Book 17

text: But if it wasn't, what was it.
Name: Book 17

text: What was happening to me.
Name: Book 17

text: "I don't understand how any of this can be possible," I told him, motioning from the image to the rest of the misty sea.
Name: Book 17

text: "Everything will soon become clear," Doc assured me.
Name: Book 17

text: "But for now, the scene, Herbert.
Name: Book 17

text: How does it make you feel.
Name: Book 17

text: It didn't appear that I was going to get any answers until I cooperated.
Name: Book 17

text: I focused my eyes on little Herbie.
Name: Book 17

text: Even frozen in place, I could see the fear in his eyes.
Name: Book 17

text: "It makes me angry.
Name: Book 17

text: I wish I had knocked the kid on his rear and socked him in the teeth.
Name: Book 17

text: "I see," Doc nodded, resting his chin between his thumb and forefinger.
Name: Book 17

text: "So your feelings regarding this event center completely on the personal pain caused.
Name: Book 17

text: Of course they did.
Name: Book 17

text: I was the one getting pounded.
Name: Book 17

text: "In this case, yes.
Name: Book 17

text: I was the only victim.
Name: Book 17

text: Doc's eyebrows raised further.
Name: Book 17

text: The mist shifted and glowed and twisted, forming a series of images depicting Timmy in various violent situations, each dissolving one after the other almost as quickly as they had formed.
Name: Book 17

text: In each of them, Timmy was either attacking another child or committing violent acts of vandalism and destruction.
Name: Book 17

text: We practically watched Timmy grow up as the scenes wore on, until finally the fog settled into an image of young Timmy surrounded by eight other boys.
Name: Book 17

text: They looked a good deal older than he, and one held a knife.
Name: Book 17

text: "You told me that you heard Timmy had gotten hurt in a tussle with fifth graders," Doc said softly.
Name: Book 17

text: "While the rumors you heard had some truth to them, the details of the incident were far different.
Name: Book 17

text: An older relative of a young man Timmy had previously assaulted gathered a group of friends to teach him a lesson.
Name: Book 17

text: They were high school students and gang members, and they beat Timmy to within an inch of his life.
Name: Book 17

text: He was stabbed in the stomach that day.
Name: Book 17

text: The fog whirled and blew, shaping into a vision of Timmy on a stretcher as paramedics loaded him into an ambulance.
Name: Book 17

text: I stared for a moment as questions and thoughts and emotions swirled in my brain like a whirlpool.
Name: Book 17

text: Finally, I managed to find my voice.
Name: Book 17

text: "I feel sorry for him, but if he hadn't picked so many fights" I was mid-sentence when the scene again changed.
Name: Book 17

text: This time, it showed something I hadn't expected.
Name: Book 17

text: The image was quite similar to the one of Timmy and myself, except this time it was Timmy who was being attacked.
Name: Book 17

text: He looked to be maybe four or five years old.
Name: Book 17

text: And his assailant, a middle-aged man nearly twice his size, had his hand around Timmy's throat.
Name: Book 17

text: "Here's a situation you might be able to empathize with," Doc said softly.
Name: Book 17

text: "That man is Timmy's father.
Name: Book 17

text: "His father beat him.
Name: Book 17

text: Multiple times a day.
Name: Book 17

text: And not because he hadn't wanted a child or because he was drunk.
Name: Book 17

text: He simply thought that was how a child should be raised.
Name: Book 17

text: It was how he'd been disciplined, how his father had been disciplined, and his father's father as well.
Name: Book 17

text: That example taught Timmy that violence was the solution to anything and everything.
Name: Book 17

text: When we originally witnessed the fight between the two of you, you came to the conclusion that Timmy simply didn't know any better.
Name: Book 17

text: And you were right.
Name: Book 17

text: I asked, shaking my head in frustration.
Name: Book 17

text: "Why does God allow things like this to happen to innocent kids.
Name: Book 17

text: "As I said, everything happens for a reason.
Name: Book 17

text: We are all products of our upbringing.
Name: Book 17

text: Much of who we are is determined by the events, memories, scars, miracles, and tragedies that we experience over the course of our lives.
Name: Book 17

text: Do you want to know what Timmy is doing these days.
Name: Book 17

text: Before I could answer, the mist coalesced into an image of an auditorium full of children.
Name: Book 17

text: On the stage stood a young man with a microphone.
Name: Book 17

text: He'd lost a good deal of weight with age, but there was no mistaking that sly grin.
Name: Book 17

text: "What is he, some kind of musician or performer.
Name: Book 17

text: "No, he's a motivational speaker," Doc explained.
Name: Book 17

text: "He travels across the country every year, visiting schools and churches to speak to kids about the dangers of bullying.
Name: Book 17

text: That was the last thing I'd expected to hear.
Name: Book 17

text: The kid who used to strike fear into the hearts of most of our class was now teaching against such behavior.
Name: Book 17

text: "You see, Herbert, after being stabbed, Timmy began to realize that a change was needed.
Name: Book 17

text: He knew he was lucky to be alive, but at the same time, fighting was all he'd ever known.
Name: Book 17

text: He continued abusing fellow students as he got older, despite knowing in his heart that it was the wrong thing to do.
Name: Book 17

text: Eventually, he found himself in juvenile hall.
Name: Book 17

text: They had a program there commonly referred to as the 'Scared Straight' program.
Name: Book 17

text: They took Timmy and a number of other youths to an adult prison to show them a taste of where their lives were headed.
Name: Book 17

text: And Timmy wanted none of it.
Name: Book 17

text: When he finally got out of juvenile, he vowed never to lay an aggressive hand on another person as long as he lived.
Name: Book 17

text: And he never did.
Name: Book 17

text: He currently lives in Indiana and is studying to become a pastor.
Name: Book 17

text: The pieces of the puzzle were finally beginning to fall into place.
Name: Book 17

text: My fight with Timmy, though it seemed like just a mean kid beating on someone smaller than him, wasn't just about me.
Name: Book 17

text: It was a part of his journey, too.
Name: Book 17

text: It was a piece of the lifelong process that turned him from child to adult, from bully to peacemaker.
Name: Book 17

text: And while our altercation didn't have an instant effect on him, it was one of the building blocks that helped him become the man he is today.
Name: Book 17

text: But how did Doc know all of this.
Name: Book 17

text: Was Timmy a patient of his.
Name: Book 17

text: He spoke before I could ask the question.
Name: Book 17

text: "As for you, this incident was the first of many that taught you compassion for those who suffer abuse at the hands of others.
Name: Book 17

text: As I've said, God works all things together for the good of His children.
Name: Book 17

text: You see now how it affected Timmy.
Name: Book 17

text: But it also helped you develop your strong sense of justice.
Name: Book 17

text: Today, you would be quick to stand up for the weak or the abused,  would you not.
Name: Book 17

text: It is a part of your personality that was formed from the years of injustice you suffered.
Name: Book 17

text: "I defend Sasha a lot at work.
Name: Book 17

text: There's a guy who works on the floor named Eddie who constantly harasses her.
Name: Book 17

text: I honestly don't know what his problem is; he's just always got her targeted.
Name: Book 17

text: When I see him bothering her, I'll come to her defense.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't know if she appreciates it or notI know some people get offended when you don't let them fight their own battlesbut all I can think about is how often I wished someone would have come to my defense when I was younger.
Name: Book 17

text: "She appreciates it," Doc assured me.
Name: Book 17

text: "More than you realize.
Name: Book 17

text: "How do you know that.
Name: Book 17

text: I asked, spreading my hands in frustration.
Name: Book 17

text: "How could you possibly know any of the things you've told me.
Name: Book 17

text: The only explanation I can come up with is that this is all one crazy dream, but it's so much more real than any dream I've ever had.
Name: Book 17

text: Doc chuckled at that.
Name: Book 17

text: "I've done my homework, Herbert.
Name: Book 17

text: I could never be effective in my work if I didn't ensure that I was well-informed about my patients.
Name: Book 17

text: When could he have done such extensive research.
Name: Book 17

text: Besides, that didn't explain the magic fog.
Name: Book 17

text: "What was that vision I had before I wound up back here.
Name: Book 17

text: Before you showed up.
Name: Book 17

text: I saw Herbie" Doc held up a hand and nodded.
Name: Book 17

text: "Don't worry, we will get to that.
Name: Book 17

text: But first, let's take a look at the next memory you and I visited.
Name: Book 17

text: The wind blew, the mist billowed, and suddenly we were looking into my parents' living room.
Name: Book 17

text: Mom was passed out on the couch with the wine bottle beside her, and Dad was rummaging through the bills.
Name: Book 17

text: "This is the day he put her head through the window," I muttered.
Name: Book 17

text: "What good could've possibly come from this.
Name: Book 17

text: "Much the same way that each of Timmy's fights were but pieces of a much larger puzzle, so too were the altercations between your parents.
Name: Book 17

text: As you now know, much of the fighting between them came as a result of drug abuse.
Name: Book 17

text: That, combined with the constant consumption of alcohol, kept them from finding any measure of peace or contentment in their lives.
Name: Book 17

text: The negative effects of their irresponsible actions are obvious.
Name: Book 17

text: However, within it all, God was using their poor judgment as a means to mold you into the person you would eventually become.
Name: Book 17

text: I raised an eyebrow.
Name: Book 17

text: "You mean cynical and bitter.
Name: Book 17

text: Herbert, most children tend to follow the example set by the adults in their lives.
Name: Book 17

text: More often than not, that means their parents.
Name: Book 17

text: They don't know how else they should conduct themselves.
Name: Book 17

text: After all, if Mommy and Daddy do it, it must be okay.
Name: Book 17

text: But you used your parents behavior as motivation to be something better.
Name: Book 17

text: You decided early on that their example was one not to be followed.
Name: Book 17

text: And to this day, you've never touched drugs or alcohol.

text: You despised what your parents were and strived to be something more.

text: That is the good that came from these kinds of incidents.

text: "But couldn't God have given me loving and hard-working parents to teach me the same lesson.

text: "Why did it have to be this way.

text: "God didn't decide what kind of people your parents would be.
Name: Book 17

text: Their choices determined who they were, just as yours have guided you.

text: God helped by granting you the wisdom to see the consequences of their actions, but the decisions were yours and yours alone.
Name: Book 17

text: It was becoming more and more clear where this was going.
Name: Book 17

text: Doc's contention has always been that each and every one of the horrible events in my lifeno, in the world.

text: brought about some measure of good somewhere along the way.
Name: Book 17

text: To an extent, I agreed, but I guess I never really grasped the vast scope of it.

text: When he said everything, he meant everything.
Name: Book 17

text: Everything from bumping into someone on the sidewalk to wars that ravage entire countries.
Name: Book 17

text: Now he was taking me over the events I showed him and illustrating to me how positive things came from each.

text: But to think that such a rule could be applied to everything in the world was absurd.
Name: Book 17

text: Did he honestly believe that humanity benefited in some way from the children across the globe that were beaten every day.

text: Women who were raped.

text: Surely, that couldn't be possible.

text: My heart stopped cold, and my eyes grew as large as dinner plates.

text: I hadn't spoken my thoughts aloud.
Name: Book 17

text: My mouth hadn't moved.

text: Yet he had somehow heard me.

text: "When a woman is raped, it isn't because God made it happen.

text: When I tell you that God brings good out of all things, you are hearing, 'It's good that she was raped.

text: As I wrote at the beginning of this entry, it seems like every doctor and nurse is shocked by my recovery.

text: It was pretty much assumed that I was going to be in a vegetative state for the rest of my life.
Name: Book 17

text: But here I am, alive and kickingliterally kicking; these blankets they keep putting over me are itchyand on the road to recovery.

text: And I will not forget what God has taught me throughout the course of this experience.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm joyful to be alive and thankful for another opportunity to make a difference in this world.
Name: Book 17

text: I will no longer live life as a spectator; I'm going to get out there and make a difference for God.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm going to encourage and uplift.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm going to use the experiences of my life to help others cope with hardship and despair.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm going to be the man that God created me to be.
Name: Book 17

text: As for this journal, I found it on the nightstand beside my bed with a leather strap around it.
Name: Book 17

text: I can't explain it; I know it shouldn't exist, but every sentence on every page is just how I remembered writing them after each memory that Doc and I visited.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't know if it was all a dream, a hallucination, or some kind of out-of-body experience.
Name: Book 17

text: All I know is that God saw fit to show me the truth behind the struggles of our lives, and I'd be an ungrateful wretch not to share that news with the rest of the world.
Name: Book 17

text: Lord, I thank you for giving an undeserving and selfish person like me a second chance to make an impact on the world by sharing the good news of Jesus Christ.
Name: Book 17

text: I promise I won't let you down.
Name: Book 17

text: Have you ever had a "That's it.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm sure you have; it happens to most people at various points in their lives.
Name: Book 17

text: It's that feeling you get when you finally manage to solve the problem in front of you.
Name: Book 17

text: Maybe you were studying for a test or writing a book or trying to follow furniture assembly instructions.
Name: Book 17

text: Most such events aren't necessarily life-altering breakthroughs of wisdom, but occasionally, one arrives at a "That's it.
Name: Book 17

text: moment that opens the floodgates of logic, reason, and above all else, comprehension.
Name: Book 17

text: Have you ever experienced such a moment.
Name: Book 17

text: For me, I'd have to say that the story documented in this book was the "That's it.
Name: Book 17

text: moment of my life.

text: It's been five years.
Name: Book 17

text: I was cleaning out my closet the other day when I came across this journal.
Name: Book 17

text: After reading over some of the entries again, I find myself amazed by how different my life is today.
Name: Book 17

text: So I felt compelled to write a brief update on the state of my life and my walk with God.
Name: Book 17

text: I can honestly say that I haven't felt any signs of depression in years, and every single day brings with it the joy of the unknown adventure that He has in store for me.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm no longer weighed down by fear and anxiety.
Name: Book 17

text: Through God's guidance, I've learned to take life as it comes with the understanding that all things, both good and bad, work together to achieve something positive in one way or another.
Name: Book 17

text: And in knowing that, I have found peace in lifesomething I had sought for a long time.
Name: Book 17

text: Believe it or not, I contacted Timmy Jentson.
Name: Book 17

text: He stopped by a middle school a few miles from me one spring to do a presentation for the students about bullying.
Name: Book 17

text: I felt like I wanted to talk to him.
Name: Book 17

text: I wanted to forgive him in person for the altercations we had in school.
Name: Book 17

text: I didn't know if he'd care.
Name: Book 17

text: Frankly, I didn't even know if he'd remember me.
Name: Book 17

text: But I felt like it was something I needed to do.
Name: Book 17

text: So I drove out that afternoon to see his presentation.
Name: Book 17

text: And what I saw blew me away.
Name: Book 17

text: Timmy was an entirely different person.
Name: Book 17

text: He was smiling, friendly, excited, and above all else, filled with the love of Jesus Christ.
Name: Book 17

text: He couldn't mention Jesus due to school regulations, of course, but the spirit and morals of his lessons practically shouted Jesus' name.
Name: Book 17

text: And he did something I honestly hadn't thought possible.
Name: Book 17

text: He created an entertaining presentation for both students and teachers alike that kept their attention, had them laughing, and even evoked some voluntary participation from several members of the audience.
Name: Book 17

text: In an age when schoolyard shootings are commonplace and suicides among youths are on the rise, it was refreshing to see the subjects of abuse, prejudice, and alienation addressed in such an honest fashion.
Name: Book 17

text: And the majority of the kids seemed to appreciate that.
Name: Book 17

text: Timmy didn't talk down to them.
Name: Book 17

text: He didn't scold, didn't shout, didn't shake a finger.
Name: Book 17

text: He simply gave his testimony.
Name: Book 17

text: Watching him that day inspired me.
Name: Book 17

text: Everyone has a gift to give to this world.
Name: Book 17

text: I truly believe that.
Name: Book 17

text: Some create music; others create medicine.
Name: Book 17

text: Some are great teachers, and others are talented athletes.
Name: Book 17

text: There are entertainers, police officers, soldiers, and painters.
Name: Book 17

text: Then there are those whose talent comes not necessarily from a skill, but from an emotional gift.
Name: Book 17

text: These are the generous people who work hard to raise money for the poor, the self-sacrificing who volunteer to work at hospitals and animal shelters, and the compassionate who travel the country trying to inspire acts of love and good works amongst the students of our nation's schools.
Name: Book 17

text: And as Timmy stood on stage revisiting his days as the schoolyard thug, I began to wonder if I could share my story the same way.
Name: Book 17

text: God doesn't grant everyone the chance to see the ripple effect that their actions have, but He showed me.
Name: Book 17

text: How could I not share that with the world.
Name: Book 17

text: How could I keep the lessons He taught me all to myself when there are so many people of all ages struggling through the very same depression that had swallowed me.
Name: Book 17

text: Maybe I could help them.
Name: Book 17

text: Perhaps my experience might strike a chord with someone out there and lead them to their own "That's it.
Name: Book 17

text: So I talked to Timmy after the show.
Name: Book 17

text: It was kind of surreal, actually, because when he saw me waiting beside the stage as the students filed out, he walked over and gave me a hug without a hint of hesitation.
Name: Book 17

text: We got a cup of coffee and caught up with each other.
Name: Book 17

text: He talked about his visit to prison and the effect it had on his opinion of life and of himself.
Name: Book 17

text: Seeing hardened criminals that had been all but forgotten by society, he said, stirred feelings inside that he never knew were there.
Name: Book 17

text: He became aware of his sense of entitlement and how he'd taken his freedom for granted.
Name: Book 17

text: One of the inmates, a convicted murderer named Alberto, left an image burned into Timmy's mind that he hopes will never fade.
Name: Book 17

text: "He had an attitude, just like me," Timmy explained.
Name: Book 17

text: "Got himself mixed up with the wrong kind of people.
Name: Book 17

text: When he was twenty-two, he got into a gang war over a couple of girls.
Name: Book 17

text: Saw his brother shot in the head that night.
Name: Book 17

text: Then, in an act of rage, he stabbed the killer in the chest seven times.
Name: Book 17

text: Timmy went on to tell me about how the man's story seemed like a window into his own future.
Name: Book 17

text: He was on the very same path, heading in the same direction, always acting on impulsive anger rather than rational thought.
Name: Book 17

text: And for a moment, just one brief second, he saw himself in Alberto's place, wearing Alberto's prison jumpsuit, covered in Alberto's scars.
Name: Book 17

text: And it scared him straight.
Name: Book 17

text: He made a vow, much like Ebenezer Scrooge, to change his ways and make the most of the days before him.
Name: Book 17

text: However, quite unlike Scrooge, it was not an overnight change.
Name: Book 17

text: He went through a long period of struggling with his anger and resentment issues as he fought to overcome the demons in his life.
Name: Book 17

text: Eventually, he found Christ, and the weight of the world was lifted from his shoulders.
Name: Book 17

text: The turning point, he told me, was when he learned to live for others rather than live for himself.
Name: Book 17

text: "I'll never forget Alberto for setting me on the right path," Timmy said.
Name: Book 17

text: "He may not know it, but he changed my life that day.
Name: Book 17

text: I shared my story with Timmy, too.
Name: Book 17

text: I told him everything about my attempted suicide and how God had taken me through the events of my life so that I could learn how and why everything had happened the way that it did.
Name: Book 17

text: I told him that I honestly believed that God had saved my life so that I could be a walking testimony of His love, power, and grace.
Name: Book 17

text: Even when I'd given up on myself, God hadn't given up on me.
Name: Book 17

text: And I told Timmy that I wanted to share my experiences with others because I knew that there were many out there suffering through the same hardships that had brought my life crashing down.
Name: Book 17

text: So we got together that summer and spent a few weeks planning out exactly what we wanted to do.
Name: Book 17

text: Using his experience as the bully and my experience as the victim, we put together two separate presentations.
Name: Book 17

text: One would be used in schools where, sad to say, we weren't allowed to speak of our spiritual convictions.
Name: Book 17

text: Instead, we used the same morals, lessons, and principals of what God had taught us to help students see the long-lasting effects of bullying.
Name: Book 17

text: Timmy is great at interacting with the kids.
Name: Book 17

text: He does a great job of keeping their attention and making them a part of everything.
Name: Book 17

text: We use the second version for our visits to churches around the country.
Name: Book 17

text: That's when I give my full-blown testimony of what happened and what God did for me.
Name: Book 17

text: At Timmy's encouragement, I also speak a little about my experience with the youth group I attended in high school.
Name: Book 17

text: Hypocrisy in the church is something I've grown very passionate about; it is the single most detrimental element to a congregation's spiritual growth, if you ask me.
Name: Book 17

text: And it seems to be spreading like wildfire these days.
Name: Book 17

text: If I can sandbag the flames at least a little in each town we visit, then I'll feel like I've accomplished something for the Lord.
Name: Book 17

text: We hope to one day visit prisons, and maybe even other countries, to share what God has taught us.
Name: Book 17

text: We've talked a lot about expanding this ministry of ours to include more types of service.
Name: Book 17

text: Actually, this winter we intend to volunteer down at the homeless shelter to help bring blankets and food to those less fortunate.
Name: Book 17

text: I know it probably sounds like I'm trying to pat myself on the back for all of these things, but the truth is that I give glory to God for all of it.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm just a servant; I don't need any thanks.
Name: Book 17

text: If anyone feels the need to show gratitude for the things that I do, they can show that gratitude to God.
Name: Book 17

text: He makes it all possible.
Name: Book 17

text: I'm just a vessel through which He moves.

Name: Book 17

text: I hadn't seen it before because I was so wrapped up in my own little world of self-pity.
Name: Book 17

text: After my relationship with Annie, I had built up these towering stone walls around myself to keep the rest of the world out.
Name: Book 17

text: I didn't want anyone to get close enough to hurt me, so I kept myself and my heart distant and protected from the world.
Name: Book 17

text: But Sasha saw right through the walls.
Name: Book 17

text: She saw the pain, she saw the fear, she saw the loneliness, and she smashed right through the concrete to tell me that I didn't need to feel lonely anymore.
Name: Book 17

text: I didn't need to be afraid anymore.
Name: Book 17

text: I didn't need to hurt anymore.
Name: Book 17

text: It took a lot of time, but I eventually mustered up the courage to take her hand.
Name: Book 17

text: And now, four years after our first date, we're planning our wedding.
Name: Book 17

text: God has woven every thread of my life together even better than I could've imagined, and I'll never ever question His judgment again.
Name: Book 17

text: Don't get me wrong.
Name: Book 17

text: I know I'm painting a picture of a perfect life, a typical happy ending with fireworks exploding above as I ride off into the sunset.
Name: Book 17

text: But life hasn't been easy by any stretch of the imagination.
Name: Book 17

text: In fact, if anything, it has been a lot tougher.
Name: Book 17

text: Timmy and I were unceremoniously kicked out of a few schools because they thought our messages were too "Christian.
Name: Book 17

text: After leaving Grocery King to travel with Timmy, I actually lived in my aeromobile for a short time because I was evicted from my apartment for failure to pay my rent.
Name: Book 17

text: And I still struggle with my old self from time to time.
Name: Book 17

text: My frustration with people rears its ugly head every now and then, but I'm learning to work through it because I know in my heart that everyone has their own battles to fight and burdens to bear.
Name: Book 17

text: Through all these things, I know that God is bringing about some good.
Name: Book 17

text: Even if it's not happening to me, even if I can't see it with my own eyes, I know that someone somewhere out there is benefiting from the troubles I've faced.
Name: Book 17

text: And that, to me, makes it all worth it.
Name: Book 17

text: The bottom line is that life isn't supposed to be easy.
Name: Book 17

text: The harder you work for things, the more rewarding and fulfilling they become.
Name: Book 17

text: Doc gave me the opportunity to change my past.
Name: Book 17

text: He must've known I wouldn't take it.
Name: Book 17

text: And I'm glad I didn't.
Name: Book 17

text: True growth is borne out of struggle.
Name: Book 17

text: The lessons learned from the hardships you endure are the reason God put you here in the first place.
Name: Book 17

text: They help you become the man or woman that He created you to be.
Name: Book 17

text: You learn more, appreciate more, grow more, and accomplish more.
Name: Book 17

text: And when you finally realize and accept this, you'll wind up feeling more peaceful, more content, and happier with life even when you find yourself facedown in the mud.
Name: Book 17

text: I don't know how this journal found its way into your possession.
Name: Book 17

text: But if there is anything I want you to take away from the testimony contained within these pages, it is the fact that everything indeed happens for a reason.
Name: Book 17

text: You may not be able to see it quite yet, but in time, you will.
Name: Book 17

text: Although life may seem like a hopeless battle, I'm here to tell you that God brings hope where there is none.
Name: Book 17

text: The trials you face are part of a larger puzzle.
Name: Book 17

text: They are, after all, the building blocks of life.
Name: Book 17

text: ####### Special thanks to my family for all of their support, and to my beautiful Laura Crump for never giving up on me.
Name: Book 17

text: Most of all, thank you God for giving me the opportunities to get my ideas onto paper.
Name: Book 17
